page.title: 05Farming in Dilhorne
page.content: The main reason for the development of Dilhorne was the large coal researves found in the area and that of Cheadle. The Foxfield Coalmine and the adjacent Parkhall mine had seems running through the area. This caused much subsidence in the past, though no coalmining is now carried out.Some of the fields show this subsidence and on occassions the N.C.B. have purchased the land as proved easier and cheaper than a long running arguement over paying compensation. This land is then rented off to the local farmers.
